item.title: German far right emboldened by Austria
item.description: Buoyed by the endorsement of Elon Musk and enjoying new highs in the polls ahead of elections in February, Germany's far-right AfD is hoping for a further boost from the success of the far right in neighbouring Austria.

item.title: Alice Weidel, German far right's unlikely hope for chancellor
item.description: As someone born in West Germany who is openly gay and has a non-German partner, Alice Weidel is in some ways a surprising choice as the far-right AfD's candidate for chancellor ahead of February elections.

item.title: Sahra Wagenknecht, Germany's combative 'left-wing conservative'
item.description: After a lifetime in opposition, Germany's hard-left standard-bearer Sahra Wagenknecht has shaken up the political scene with a blend of pro-poor, Moscow-friendly and anti-immigration policies.

item.title: Four places in Germany experts say you should visit in 2025
item.description: Several German destinations have been recommended by travel writers as being among the best places to visit in 2025. If you live in Germany, or are planning to visit soon, here are some places to consider visiting this year.

item.title: The jobs where employees earn the most (and least) in Germany
item.description: The industries where people in Germany command the highest salaries - and the sectors which don't pay as well - have been highlighted in a new study.

item.title: The big changes for families in Germany in 2025
item.description: From a hike in child benefits to parental allowance adjustments via the possibility of paid paternity leave, we look at what's changing for families in Germany - and what's not - this year.

item.title: 'Inviolability of borders applies to every country': Scholz
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said Saturday that the principle of sovereign borders must be protected, days after US President-elect Donald Trump refused to rule out force to seize Greenland.

item.title: Musk, ex-EU tech chief Breton spar over Germany
item.description: Elon Musk escalated a spat Saturday with the ex-EU digital chief Thierry Breton, describing him as a "tyrant of Europe" as the two men traded barbs online.

item.title: German far-right outlines radical programme as protesters rally
item.description: The far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party set out a radical programme on Saturday at a party congress ahead of next month's snap general election as thousands of protesters took to the streets to voice their opposition to the party.

item.title: Inside Germany: Election campaign ramps up, sick leave row and the year of Chemnitz
item.description: From a strange election campaign week involving fake cake and misinformation to a debate about sick leave, queues for kebabs and Chemnitz in the spotlight, here's what we're talking about at The Local.

item.title: Germany battles to secure stricken 'Russian shadow fleet' oil tanker
item.description: Germany was battling Saturday to secure a heavily loaded tanker stranded off its northern coast, towing the stricken ship that it said was part of Russia's sanctions-busting "shadow fleet" away from shore to avert an oil spill.

item.title: Why German business leaders want to cut back on paid sick leave for employees
item.description: Employees in Germany tend to take more sick days off work than those in surrounding countries. Could a new proposal to cut sick pay be the answer?

item.title: The immigration changes that may affect foreigners in Germany this year
item.description: Several changes to migration rules have come into effect since the start of 2025, and further changes are being debated. Here are the ones likely to have the biggest impact on the lives of Germany's foreign residents.

item.title: Skiing in Germany: How to check if there’s snow on the slopes
item.description: Planning a ski trip in Germany? Here’s how to check snow conditions with real-time resources like snow forecasts and webcams.

item.title: 'Not compatible': Dozens of German universities turn back on social media platform X
item.description: Dozens of German universities said on Friday they would no longer use social network X - owned by the world's richest man, Elon Musk - citing ethical concerns.

item.title: One death reported as snow and storms lash Germany
item.description: One person is reported to have died and there have been several accidents as freezing weather, snow and storms have hit Germany.

item.title: Germany reports foot-and-mouth disease in water buffalo
item.description: Germany on Friday reported three cases of foot-and-mouth disease in water buffalo on a farm near Berlin, the country's first reported cases of the livestock disease since 1988.

item.title: OPINION: Why challenging your high rent in Germany is a civic duty to other tenants
item.description: Rental costs across Germany continue to rise at alarming rates. Since rent control laws are only enforced when tenants invoke them, Paul Krantz argues that doing so should be seen as a civic duty to help keep rents down.

item.title: FACT CHECK: The false claims made during AfD's chat with Musk ahead of German election
item.description: US tech billionaire Elon Musk spoke with the far-right AfD's chancellor candidate in a livestream - but misinformation was rampant. We debunk some of the notable false claims and misleading information from the pre-election conversation.

item.title: Health experts warn of emerging flu wave in Germany
item.description: The number of cases of influenza is increasing in Germany along with hospital admissions, leading experts to warn of an incoming flu wave.
